title: You climbed to 90lp
body: Then lost every game till you were at 0 lp. How common is this experience?

replies.body: Got to silver 1 promos then kept losing till silver 5
Change this to Silver 3 promos and that's my end of ranked experience.  I stopped playing ranked once I hit 0 LP in Silver 5.
yep happened to me
wtf?
It was a bad streak. I got back to silver 3 since then and called it a season
I usually get to promos then go back to 0

This is usually the pattern for me too, get to 85+, lose 1, then win 2 in a row to get to promos>>>> Then get absolutely shit all over in promos (maybe winning 1) and lose my way back down to 0 with teams that at the very least seem like rito is trying to fuck me.

The worst part isn't having to get back up to where you were after a loss streak.
The worst part is that after a loss streak, you earn less than 20 lp per win and lose more than 20 lp per loss. So, before you can even think about actually climbing again, you have to focus more on repairing your MMR that the match maker detonated!

I think one of the largest problems, is a mix of two things

People not only expect riot to matchmake them with EQUAL players to them
But they also completely and utterly believe that riot *isn't capable* of stacking the deck HEAVILY against them intentionally.

I'm not saying with 100% surety that riot definitely rigs their games, but these 2 statements are somewhat contradictory

Either, they're not matchmaking your allies and enemies based off of your own skill level, meaning RNG is the only thing that you can attribute winning to (until high elos because law of probability, its unlikely that a trash player can make it up high whereas a skilled player can minorly influence their winrate and steadily climb)

Or they are *ABLE* to rig games, if they *can* matchmake based on player skill level


Again, we'd need to see riot's algorithms and crap, which obviously will never happen (or if it ever somehow **does**, there's still the ability for them to just omit part of the equasion, leaving us in a permanent state of 'can't confirm nor deny it tbh'), i wont bullshit everyone by saying "YEAH RIOT RIGS THEIR SHIT I KNOW ITS GUARENTEED NOT A DOUBT IN MY MIND" but the pattern is far too wide-spread and _consistent_ to be a coincidence, in my eyes.
{{sticker:zombie-brand-clap}}

did you completely and utterly ignore the entire post
it's ***physically impossible*** to take a look at riot's matchmaking sorting algorithm because it's private or whatever.
Ask around any big group of league players, how many of them just barely made it up to the top of a division before having an uncontrollable loss streak

if they just raise the enemy's difficulty, why does it never feel like "woah the enemy is being smarter or playing better", why is it always just "god fucking dammit botlane how are you 0/20 by the time i got to my wolves camp.."
if the enemy got significantly better that'd be fine, i like a challenge and it fits the motif of "carry yourself as hard as you can". But why make your *enemies* better when your **allies** can just be flaming dog shit? And then lets carry that for a few games so its less suspicious that it almost always happens at the same LP threshold.

> did you completely and utterly ignore the entire post
> it's physically impossible to take a look at riot's matchmaking sorting algorithm because it's private or whatever.

I never said to do that. I asked for datas. I asked you to take 10 000 players playing ranked regularly. You look at their progression through the ladder for the last 6 months. And you check if right after getting 90+ Lps you see an unusual number of them starting a losing streak. Then you check if these losing streaks are due to an unusual number of sub-performing players in their team. That's what I would call "datas which backup your claims".

You can do some basic retro-engineering on their algorithm looking at its input and output. And fortunately riots is happy to give you both since you can query their API to get accurate datas on every single ranked games.

> Ask around any big group of league players, how many of them just barely made it up to the top of a division before having an uncontrollable loss streak

How do I ask a big enough group ? How do I prevent only those who experimented that to answer ? How do I account for the cognitive bias ? You are way more likely to remember that you had a losing streak than not having it. So if you reached 90 LP 20 times in the season and went on losing streak 2 times, you'll remember these 2 losing streak while ignoring the 18 time it didnt occur. 

Humans and their memory are flawed, raw facts and pure data is the only reliable source of information. 

Last time someone complained he was on winning streak and then riot gave him stupid allies I went to check his history, the 2 allies he called stupid had been hard carring a lot of games before playing in his game and doing quite bad. The matchmaking can only base it's matching previsions on the past. If someone was playing well and then starts to do stupid things that's not something the matchmaking could foresee, even if they WANTED to do it it would be impossible.

Never attribute to malice that which is adequately explained by stupidity.
